line_1: The laddies scoff, the lassies jeer; —
line_2: Now, when I gae to kirk or fair,

line_1: The laddies scoff, the lassies jeer; —
line_2: "Is this poor Jock? — the good be here!

line_1: And held til his een, for he's given to jeer;
line_2: 'Twas weel for his sel his cwoat lappet was near.

line_1: With honest gibe, and moral jeer,
I'll speak up to Maggie, who often would jeer,
line_2: And cry, "She's no canty, 'cause Willie's no here."

line_1: Sae let's hae nae mair o' thy jeer;
line_2: And they'll nit new don her, I fear.

line_1: Here Grub-street geese presume to joke and jeer,
line_2: All, all but Grannam Osborne's Gazetteer.
And had the true free-thinking sneer;
